body_html:
Hi @MingyaoLiu,

The inability of the tensorflow project to properly support bazel 0.19.1 (which was the decision of that same project to use it as a build tool) CAN be IMHO called the ugly situation, and therefore I DO feel pity about it.
Since this version of bazel was allowed on the Ubuntu 18.04 (which is already not the last but previous to the last release of Ubuntu), then I can with some confidence say that this version of bazel was "a bit" tested before, therefore I would say it is likely to be not about the bugs in the new software, but rather about the changes in it, which were not considered in the tensorflow project.

body:
Hi @MingyaoLiu,

The inability of the tensorflow project to properly support bazel 0.19.1 (which was the decision of that same project to use it as a build tool) CAN be IMHO called the ugly situation, and therefore I DO feel pity about it.
Since this version of bazel was allowed on the Ubuntu 18.04 (which is already not the last but previous to the last release of Ubuntu), then I can with some confidence say that this version of bazel was "a bit" tested before, therefore I would say it is likely to be not about the bugs in the new software, but rather about the changes in it, which were not considered in the tensorflow project.
